alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 3:40PM MST until January 21 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation of freezing rain and occasional snow. Ice accumulations around one tenth up to two tenths of an inch. Snow accumulation of less than an inch in the valleys. * WHERE...Wenatchee area, Waterville Plateau, Okanogan Valley and Highlands, Northeast Washington Mountains and the north Idaho Panhandle. * WHEN...Until noon PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is a 30-40% chance for at least 0.05 of an inch of ice accumulation.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
